alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 6:49AM MDT until June 16 at 10:51AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Palouse River near Potlatch affecting Latah and Whitman Counties. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. Pend Oreille River below Albeni Falls affecting Pend Oreille and Bonner Counties. Rivers across the region are cresting and will slowly recede over the 12 to 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Water may be over St Joe City Road. Flooding will occur throughout the low lying areas of the St Joe Valley. Flooding of Aqua Park and outbuildings along the river that are not behind the levee will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 32.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM PDT Wednesday was 33.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting at 33.0 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage tonight. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM PDT.
